definition: to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: He is dyslexic and a college dropout.
sentences.chinese: 他有誦讀困難症，還是一名大學退學生。

sentences.english: You'd be crazy to drop out.
Refund of outstanding tuition fees will be calculated based on the date written notification was received by SRIS .
sentences.chinese: 學費返還金額將從學校收到書面退學通知之日起計算。

sentences.english: The boys lived, but the illness induced by their exposure forced them to drop out of school.
sentences.chinese: 他們活了下來，但是毒氣造成的疾病讓他們被迫退學。

sentences.english: Does that mean you should drop out of Harvard and invest in a nose job?
sentences.chinese: 這是否意味着應該從哈佛退學而投資自己的鼻子？

sentences.english: Jack wants to do business in China, so he droped out.
sentences.chinese: 傑克因爲想在中國發展，所以他決定退學了。

sentences.english: Stealing from a teacher led to his expulsive from high school.
sentences.chinese: 因爲向老師行竊，導致他在上學時被退學。

sentences.english: This is the second time he has flunked out of college.
sentences.chinese: 這是他第二次因不及格而遭大學退學。

sentences.english: Blevins recalled. "I just knew I didn't want to quit."
sentences.chinese: 這時布來溫又改口到，不，但我又不能退學。

sentences.english: The students said that if this can not come back to school on the drop-out .
sentences.chinese: 學生們表示，若不能回本部讀書就退學。

sentences.english: Because of the small dread half after the drop, when a deserter.
sentences.chinese: 因爲小丁在讀過半年後就自動退學，當了逃兵。

sentences.english: The deposit will be refunded when students withdraw or graduate from KCS.
sentences.chinese: 家長服務按金在學生退學或畢業時退回。

sentences.english: Students with more than four unexcused absences shall be dropped from the class.
sentences.chinese: 未經允許缺席四次以上會被勒令退學。

sentences.english: I have not completed any application process for study at nor have I been expelled from other universities.
sentences.chinese: 本人在華未曾完成申請就學學程或遭退學。

sentences.english: His mother doesn't want him to be friends with those dropouts.
sentences.chinese: 他的媽媽不想他和那些退學生交朋友。

sentences.english: I m thinking of dropping out of college.
sentences.chinese: 我正考慮從大學中退學。

definition: to drop out of school/to leave off studying/to interrupt one's studies
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to change schools/to transfer to another college
foundation of a University or College/school opening/the start of a new term
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
to be determined to/to insist on
